::: contentWrapper
# How to mount Rails {#how-to-mount-rails .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

::: sections
OVERDRIVE rails are designed to be pushed onto the sides of the track
using clips that are built into the rails. If you find that the rails
are falling off the track easily or if your cars are knocking them off
the track, then most likely reason is because they are not installed
properly.

Each rail has 3 to 4 clips that need to be fully inserted into the
track. This will require a little bit of force to correctly clip them on
to the tracks.

You can easily tell if a clip is inserted fully or not by turning the
track piece over and checking the clips. 
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
See illustrations below on how to check if the clips are inserted fully
or not.

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d77512c7d3a7e9ae9e3e1/img-25345-1585280698-1042446345.jpg){width="245"
height="172"} ![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d775104286364bc975cb0/img-25345-1585280698-1612422717.jpg){width="246"
height="173"}
:::
